question: Identify the polymer used in making floor tiles. [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Identify the polymer used in making floor tiles. [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: High-density polyethylene (HDPE) is commonly used for manufacturing floor tiles due to its durability and chemical resistance.

question: X-ray diffraction gives all the information regarding nanoparticles EXCEPT the.
question_latex: X-ray diffraction gives all the information regarding nanoparticles EXCEPT the.
solution: XRD provides information about crystal structure, particle size, and geometry; however, binding nature is typically analyzed using FTIR spectroscopy.

question: Which from following formulae is a correct formula to determine percent atom economy? [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Which from following formulae is a correct formula to determine percent atom economy? [MHT-CET 2021]
options: A. % Atom economy = Sum of formula weight of all reactants x 100
B. % Atom economy = (Formula weight of desired product / Sum of formula weight of all reactants) x 100
C. % Atom economy = (Sum of formula weight of all reactants / Formula weight of desired product) x 100
D. % Atom economy = Formula weight of product x 100
answer: B. % Atom economy = (Formula weight of desired product / Sum of formula weight of all reactants) x 100
solution: $\text{\% Atom economy} = \frac{\text{Formula weight of desired product}}{\text{Sum of formula weight of all reactants}} \times 100$

question: Identify the example of zero-dimensional nanostructure from following. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Identify the example of zero-dimensional nanostructure from following. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Quantum dots are classified as zero-dimensional (0D) nanostructures because all three dimensions are at the nanoscale.

question: Which of the following can be categorised as two dimensional nanostructure?
question_latex: Which of the following can be categorised as two dimensional nanostructure?
solution: Thin films are two-dimensional nanostructures where only one dimension is at the nanoscale, while the other two are outside the nanoscale.

question: Calculate percentage atom economy when 46 g ethanol is obtained from 64.5 g chloroethane and 56 g KOH(aq). [2025]
question_latex: Calculate percentage atom economy when $46\text{ g}$ ethanol is obtained from $64.5\text{ g}$ chloroethane and $56\text{ g } KOH(aq)$. [2025]
solution: $\text{\% atom economy} = \frac{\text{Formula weight of the desired product}}{\text{Sum of formula weight of all the reactants}} \times 100 = \frac{46}{64.5 + 56} \times 100 = \frac{46}{120.5} \times 100 = 38.17\%$

question: Green chemistry is an approach to chemistry that aims to.. and..on human health and environment.
question_latex: Green chemistry is an approach to chemistry that aims to.. and..on human health and environment.
options: A. maximize efficiency, maximize hazardous effects
B. maximize efficiency, minimize hazardous effects
C. minimize efficiency, minimize hazardous effects
D. minimize efficiency, maximize hazardous effects
answer: B. maximize efficiency, minimize hazardous effects
solution: Green chemistry focuses on maximizing the efficiency of chemical processes while minimizing negative impacts on health and the environment.

question: The size range of molecules of lipids and proteins is about........
question_latex: The size range of molecules of lipids and proteins is about........
solution: Biological molecules like lipids and proteins typically fall in the size range of $1$ to $10\text{ nm}$.

question: Identify the correct decreasing order of size of nanomaterial from following. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Identify the correct decreasing order of size of nanomaterial from following. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Cancer cell > Bacteria > Virus > Antibody
B. Virus > Bacteria > Cancer cell > Antibody
C. Bacteria > Virus > Antibody > Cancer cell
D. Antibody > Virus > Bacteria > Cancer cell
answer: A. Cancer cell > Bacteria > Virus > Antibody
solution: The correct biological size hierarchy is: Cancer cell (approx $10-100\text{ \mu m}$) > Bacteria ($1-10\text{ \mu m}$) > Virus ($20-400\text{ nm}$) > Antibody ($10\text{ nm}$).

question: Nanotechnology can be used in
options: A. revolution in electronics and computing
solution: Nanotechnology has broad applications across electronics, energy, medicine, and many other fields.

question: Nanoparticles can be used to make
question_latex: Nanoparticles can be used to make
solution: Nanoparticles are utilized in scratch-resistant coatings for glasses, UV protection in sunscreens, and enhancing material durability.

question: Which of the following house hold plastic material is used to prepare drinking straws? [2025, 2021]
question_latex: Which of the following house hold plastic material is used to prepare drinking straws? [2025, 2021]
solution: Polypropylene (PP) is widely used for making drinking straws because of its flexibility and heat resistance.

question: Which of the following information is given by UV-visible spectroscopy?
question_latex: Which of the following information is given by UV-visible spectroscopy?
options: B. Preliminary confirmation of formation of nanoparticles
answer: B. Preliminary confirmation of formation of nanoparticles
solution: UV-visible spectroscopy is used for the preliminary characterization and confirmation of nanoparticle formation by observing surface plasmon resonance.

question: Which of the following is nanostructured material?
question_latex: Which of the following is nanostructured material?
solution: Carbon black is a nanostructured material commonly used as a reinforcing agent in tires.

question: PVC (polyvinyl chloride) is used in
solution: PVC is used in the production of various containers, including mouth-wash bottles, due to its chemical resistance.

question: Which from following techniques is used for preliminary confirmation of nanoparticles? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which from following techniques is used for preliminary confirmation of nanoparticles? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: UV-visible spectroscopy is the standard preliminary technique to confirm the synthesis of metal nanoparticles.

question: Which of the following nanostructured material is used in tyres of car to increase the life of tyre?
question_latex: Which of the following nanostructured material is used in tyres of car to increase the life of tyre?
solution: Carbon black particles enhance the mechanical properties and durability of rubber in automotive tires.

question: In the manufacture of $H_2SO_4$ by contact process, the catalyst used is.........
question_latex: In the manufacture of $H_{2}SO_{4}$ by contact process, the catalyst used is.........
solution: Platinised asbestos or $V_2O_5$ is used as a catalyst in the contact process for sulfuric acid production.

question: To detect the binding nature of nanomaterial which of the following techniques need to be employed?
question_latex: To detect the binding nature of nanomaterial which of the following techniques need to be employed?
solution: FTIR (Fourier Transform Infrared Spectroscopy) is used to identify functional groups and detect the binding nature of capping agents on nanoparticles.

question: Which of the following is/are the role of green chemistry?
question_latex: Which of the following is/are the role of green chemistry?
options: A. Helps to protect the presence of ozone layer
B. To control green house effect, global warming
C. Helps to reduce capital expenditure
solution: Green chemistry aims to solve environmental issues like ozone depletion and global warming while improving industrial efficiency.

question: Thin films are the examples of
question_latex: Thin films are the examples of
solution: Thin films are 2D nanostructures where one dimension is nanometer-sized.

question: All the following statements are CORRECT, EXCEPT:
question_latex: All the following statements are CORRECT, EXCEPT:
options: A. Nanoparticles of ZnO and TiO2 present in sunscreens protect the skin from harmful UV rays.
B. Nanoparticles can cause lung damage.
C. A zero dimensional structure is one in which all three dimensions are in the nanoscale.
D. One nanometer is one millionth of a meter.
answer: D. One nanometer is one millionth of a meter.
solution: One nanometer is $10^{-9}\text{ m}$, which is one billionth of a meter, not one millionth.

question: Polypropylene (PP) is recycled to make
solution: Recycled PP is commonly used for manufacturing heavy-duty items like battery cables and broom bristles.

question: Good atom economy means
solution: A high atom economy indicates that most of the reactant mass is converted into the desired product, resulting in minimal waste.

question: Identify the principle suggesting to avoid protection and deprotection of selective group for organic reactions in green chemistry [2025]
question_latex: Identify the principle suggesting to avoid protection and deprotection of selective group for organic reactions in green chemistry [2025]
solution: The principle of 'Reduce Derivatives' suggests avoiding unnecessary derivatization (like protecting groups) to improve atom economy and reduce waste.

question: Identify one dimensional nanostructure from following.
solution: Nanowires are one-dimensional nanostructures as their length is much greater than width.

question: Which among the following compounds is used to prepare adipic acid using enzymes by Drath and Frost technology?
solution: In Drath and Frost technology, adipic acid is enzymatically synthesised from glucose.

question: Which from following is an example of one dimensional nanostructure?
solution: Nanorods are one-dimensional nanostructures.

question: Identify sequential reactions involved in sol-gel process.
solution: Sol-gel process involves hydrolysis followed by polycondensation.

question: Coccus are ____ shaped.
solution: Coccus bacteria are spherical in shape.

question: In organic synthesis the use of protecting or blocking group ____ its atom economy.
solution: Protecting groups increase steps and waste, decreasing atom economy.

question: Which of the following is γ-isomer of BHC?
solution: Lindane is the $\gamma$-isomer of benzene hexachloride (BHC).

question: Drath and Frost developed a green technology for the synthesis of adipic acid from
solution: Adipic acid is synthesised from glucose using green enzymatic technology.

question: Which of the following is effectively used instead of DDT?
solution: DDT insecticide has been replaced by BHC.

question: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry in year 2005 was awarded for the work
options: B. Concerning formation and deposition of ozone
D. Concerning the development of metathesis method in organic chemistry
answer: D. Concerning the development of metathesis method in organic chemistry
solution: Nobel Prize 2005 was awarded to Chauvin, Grubbs and Schrock for metathesis reactions.

question: What is the advantage of nano-composite packaging?
options: B. Enhanced thermal stability, conductivity and mechanical strength
solution: Nano-composites show multiple improved properties.

question: Which of the following solvents reduces environmental pollution?
solution: Water is a green solvent and does not cause air pollution.

question: Which of the following pair of metals is used in hydrogenation reactions?
solution: Platinum and palladium are commonly used hydrogenation catalysts.

question: What is the value of percent atom economy if total molar mass of reactants is 36 u and mass of product is 27 u?
Which among following solvents is considered as green solvent?
solution: Supercritical CO$_2$ is considered a green solvent.

question: ZWT in green chemistry stands for
solution: ZWT refers to zero waste technology.

question: Which from following nanomaterial has one dimension less than 100 nm?
solution: Thin films have one dimension in nanoscale.

question: For the manufacture of HDPE, the catalyst used is
solution: Ziegler–Natta catalyst is used for HDPE synthesis.

question: Which among the following statements is NOT true according to principles of green chemistry?
options: A. Benzene being volatile compound pollutes air
B. Use of catalyst minimizes waste
C. Use renewable chemicals rather than crude oil
D. Carrying out reactions at high temperature and high pressure minimizes waste
answer: D. Carrying out reactions at high temperature and high pressure minimizes waste
solution: High temperature and pressure increase energy consumption, against green chemistry.

question: The development that meets the needs of present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs is known as
solution: This definition refers to sustainable development.

question: Invention of STM led to the discovery of
options: B. Scanning tunneling microscopy, carbon nanotubes
D. Scanning tunneling microscopy, silver nanoparticles
solution: STM invention contributed to discovery of fullerenes.

question: Using green pathway, adipic acid is manufactured from
solution: Green pathway uses glucose as raw material.

question: Disposable cups and plates are made from
solution: Polystyrene is used for disposable cups and plates.

question: What type of information is collected using scanning electron microscopy?
solution: SEM provides surface morphology information.

question: What type of reaction is sol-gel process?
solution: Sol-gel process involves inorganic polymerisation reactions.

question: Gelation process which occurs during the wet chemical synthesis of nanomaterials is the result of..
question_latex: Gelation process which occurs during the wet chemical synthesis of nanomaterials is the result of..
solution: In the wet chemical synthesis (sol-gel process), the gelation process is a result of the polycondensation reaction where the 'sol' particles connect to form a three-dimensional network known as a 'gel'.

question: What is value of percent atom economy when reactants having sum of formula weight 78 u results in formation of product with formula weight 65 u?
solution: %~Atom~economy~=~\frac{\text{Formula weight of product}}{\text{Sum of formula weights of reactants}}\times100~=~\frac{65}{78}\times100~=~83\%

question: What is percentage atom economy during conversion of reactant to product if formula weight of reactants is 246 u and of product is 123 u?
solution: %~Atom~economy~=~\frac{123}{246}\times100~=~50\%

question: Which from following chemical activities does NOT exhibit good atom economy according to the principles of green chemistry?
options: B. Action of HX on alkene to form alkyl halide
D. Formation of cyclohexanol from phenol by catalytic hydrogenation
solution: Formation of Grignard reagent produces by-products and does not exhibit good atom economy.

question: The size of nanomaterials ranges between
solution: Nanomaterials are defined as materials having size between $1$ and $100\,nm$.

question: Which among the following statements is against the principles of green chemistry?
options: A. Protecting and deprotecting functional groups reduces number of steps
B. Use of renewable resources ensures the sharing of resources by future generations
C. Unnecessary derivatization should be minimized
D. Use of biodegradable polymers help to clean the environment
answer: A. Protecting and deprotecting functional groups reduces number of steps
solution: Protecting and deprotecting increases steps and waste, hence against green chemistry.

question: Greeks and Romans has used nanoparticles in the manufacture of
solution: Nanoparticles were historically used in hair dyes by Greeks and Romans.

question: The diameter of colloidal particles ranges between
solution: Colloidal particles generally fall in the nanometer range.

question: DDT stands for
solution: DDT is dichlorodiphenyl trichloroethane.

question: Identify the use of polystyrene for household purposes
options: A. To manufacture disposable cups and plates
B. To prepare bottles for storage of mouth wash
D. To prepare microwave food trays
answer: A. To manufacture disposable cups and plates
solution: Polystyrene is commonly used to make disposable cups and plates.

question: What type of information is collected using FTIR spectroscopy?
solution: FTIR spectroscopy identifies functional groups by absorption peaks.

question: Chemical synthesis should be designed to
options: A. Minimize the use of energy
B. Maximize the use of energy
C. Achieve the use of non-renewable materials
answer: A. Minimize the use of energy
solution: Energy efficiency is a key principle of green chemistry.

question: Provides more number of reaction sites that leads to higher chemical reactivity of nanoparticles
options: B. High surface area to volume ratio
answer: B. High surface area to volume ratio
solution: Nanoparticles have very high surface area to volume ratio increasing reactivity.

question: Richard Feynman is often credited with predicting the potential of nanotechnology. What was the title of his famous speech?
options: B. There is a tiny room at the bottom
C. There is plenty of room at the bottom
answer: C. There is plenty of room at the bottom
solution: This lecture laid the foundation of nanotechnology.

question: Identify the instrument used to find crystal structure
solution: XRD is used to determine crystal structure.

question: Identify the ratio that decides the higher reactivity of nanomaterials as catalyst
solution: Higher surface area to volume ratio increases catalytic activity.

question: Fumed silica is a component of
solution: Fumed silica is used as reinforcing filler in silicone rubber.

question: Percent atom economy is given by the formula
options: A. Formula weight of all reactants / formula weight of product
B. Formula weight of product / formula weight of all reactants
C. Formula weight of desired product / sum of formula weights of all reactants
answer: C. Formula weight of desired product / sum of formula weights of all reactants
solution: This expression defines atom economy in green chemistry.

question: Nanoparticles of ZnO and TiO$_2$ are also used in
solution: ZnO and TiO$_2$ nanoparticles act as photocatalysts.

question: Which of the following is used to prepare bottles for soft drinks?
solution: PETE is widely used for soft drink bottles.

question: Planting more and more trees help to
options: A. Reduce CO$_2$ in the air
B. Increase CO$_2$ in the air
C. Reduce O$_2$ in the air
D. Reduce CO$_2$ and increase O$_2$
answer: D. Reduce CO$_2$ and increase O$_2$
solution: Plants absorb CO$_2$ and release O$_2$ during photosynthesis.

question: The instrument used to observe the cells is
solution: Cells are observed using a microscope.

question: Which from following statements is NOT correct according to principles of green chemistry?
options: A. Avoid formation of hazardous waste
B. Less weight of desired product and greater weight of sum of formula weights of reactants is favoured
C. Use of waste product of one system is raw material for other system
D. Use of microorganisms for organic synthesis
answer: B. Less weight of desired product and greater weight of sum of formula weights of reactants is favoured
solution: Green chemistry favors maximum desired product and minimum waste.

question: Which of the following plastic material contains phthalates that interfere with hormonal development?
solution: PVC contains phthalates which can disrupt hormonal activity.

question: LDPE (Low Density Polyethylene) is recycled to make
solution: Recycled LDPE is commonly used to make custom-made plastic products.

question: Phenol + Cl$_2$ on UV light gives γ-isomer of 'Y'. 'Y' is called as
solution: Chlorination under UV leads to formation of benzene hexachloride; its $\gamma$-isomer is lindane.

question: Prefix 'nano' comes from
solution: The word nano originates from Greek meaning dwarf.

question: Identify the polymer used to obtain disposable cups and plates
solution: Polystyrene is widely used for disposable cups and plates.

question: XRD stands for
solution: XRD refers to X-ray diffraction technique.

question: Identify the formula weight of product if percent atom economy is 30% and formula weight of reactants is 90 u
solution: $30~=~\frac{x}{90}\times100~\Rightarrow~x~=~27~u$

question: Carbon nanotubes are made up of ____ sheets with nano-sized diameter and they have strength
solution: Carbon nanotubes are rolled graphene sheets derived from graphite and possess high strength.

question: Which of the following is the application of nanotechnology to food science and technology?
solution: Nanotechnology is applied in agriculture, food safety and product development.

question: The green technology developed by Drath and Frost is used for synthesis of
solution: Drath and Frost developed enzymatic synthesis of adipic acid.

question: Beautiful ruby red colour of some ancient glass paintings is due to ____ and ____ nanoparticles trapped in the glass matrix
solution: Gold and silver nanoparticles impart ruby red colour to ancient glass.

question: Identify zero dimensional nanostructure from following
solution: Nanoparticles are zero dimensional nanostructures.

question: Select the incorrect statement
options: A. TiO$_2$ and ZnO are used in photocatalysis
B. Due to optical property, if 100 gold atoms arranged in cube, its colour would be red
C. Nanoparticle catalyst can be easily separated and can be recycled
solution: All given statements are correct.

question: Match the following
solution: Correct matching based on applications of nanomaterials.

question: Which from following nanomaterial is smallest in size?
solution: Antibodies are smaller than viruses, bacteria and cancer cells.

question: Which solvent from following is used in order to avoid creation of waste and pollution of air?
solution: Water is the green solvent as it does not cause air pollution.

question: The catalyst used in the hydrogenation of oils is
solution: Nickel is commonly used as catalyst for hydrogenation of oils.

question: All the following statements are CORRECT, EXCEPT
options: A. Sols are colloidal dispersions involving bottom-up approach
B. In top-down approach nanomaterials are synthesized from bulk material
C. Sol-gel process is widely employed to prepare oxide materials
D. Nanomaterials are always synthesized by breaking the material
answer: D. Nanomaterials are always synthesized by breaking the material
solution: Bottom-up approaches also exist; hence statement D is incorrect.

question: What is the formula weight of reactants if formula weight of product is 35 u and percent atom economy is 40%?
solution: $40~=~\frac{35}{x}\times100~\Rightarrow~x~=~87.5~u$

question: What is the percent atom economy when a product of mass 80 u is obtained from two different reactants having sum of formula weight 240 u?
Which from following nanoparticle catalyst is used in photocatalysis?
solution: TiO$_2$ nanoparticles are widely used in photocatalysis.

question: Which of the following is INCORRECT?
options: A. PET is recycled to make furniture
B. HDPE is recycled to make detergent bottles
C. Polystyrene is used in making disposable cups and plates
D. Polypropylene is used to make microwave food trays
answer: A. PET is recycled to make furniture
solution: PET is commonly recycled to make fibres, not furniture.

question: Identify nanomaterial having all three dimensions in the nanoscale
solution: Quantum dots are zero dimensional with all dimensions in nanoscale.

question: Salicylic acid + acetyl chloride in pyridine gives ____ + HCl
solution: Acetylation of salicylic acid forms acetylsalicylic acid (aspirin).

question: Which of the following information about nanoparticles can be obtained using UV-visible spectrophotometer?
options: A. Preliminary confirmation of formation of nanoparticles
answer: A. Preliminary confirmation of formation of nanoparticles
solution: UV-visible spectroscopy confirms nanoparticle formation via SPR bands.

question: In a chemical reaction, sum of formula weight of all reactants is 274 u and atom economy is 50%. Calculate formula weight of desired product
solution: $50~=~\frac{x}{274}\times100~\Rightarrow~x~=~137~u$

question: The concept of green chemistry was coined by
solution: Paul Anastas is known as the father of green chemistry.
